### Weibull Distribution 


The probability density function of $X$ is


\[\begin{aligned} f(x;\alpha, \beta)&=\frac{\alpha}{\beta} \bigg(\dfrac{x}{\beta}\bigg)^{\alpha-1}e^{-\big(\dfrac{x}{\beta}\big)^\alpha};\;  \end{aligned} \]
where $x>0$ and $\alpha,\beta>0$


<p>
\noindent The distribution function of X is

\[\begin{aligned} F(x) &= 1- e^{-\big(x/\beta\big)^\alpha}. \end{aligned} \]
\[F(x)=1 - \operatorname{Exp}\left( - (x/\beta )^\alpha\right) .\]


\noindent The mean and variance of a Weibull random variable can be expressed as

\[{\displaystyle \operatorname {E} (X)=\beta \Gamma \left(1+{\frac {1}{\alpha}}\right)\,}\]
and

\[{\displaystyle \operatorname {Var} (X)=\beta ^{2}\left[\Gamma \left(1+{\frac {2}{\alpha}}\right)-\left(\Gamma \left(1+{\frac {1}{\alpha}}\right)\right)^{2}\right]\,.}\]
